revised_title: Spatiotemporal Interpolation and Visual Hyperacuity: Exploring Vernier Discrimination Thresholds
tldr: The article investigates the precision of the human visual system's ability to interpolate spatial and temporal information, specifically focusing on vernier acuity. The authors found that the visual system can accurately interpolate the position of a feature in the visual field, even when the target is moving. They also discovered that temporal and spatial interpolation depend on different parameters and that the basic properties of spatiotemporal interpolation can be understood in terms of the known properties of the visual system.
